meanings.definition: To lead or guide by persuasion or deceit.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox toled the rabbit into following him.
meanings.sent2: She toled her friend to the secret hideout with promises of adventure.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat toled the curious dog into a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The sly salesman toled the unsuspecting customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent5: The enchanting melody toled the listeners into a state of tranquility.

meanings.sent1: The aroma of freshly baked cookies toled the children into the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The shiny object toled the magpie closer to investigate.
meanings.sent3: The colorful advertisement toled customers into the store with promises of discounts.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious treasure map toled the adventurers into the unknown jungle.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city toled the young dreamer into a world of possibilities.

meanings.sent1: The tempting aroma of the freshly baked pie toled him into taking a bite.
meanings.sent2: The seductive dance toled him into a whirlwind romance.
meanings.sent3: The alluring smile toled him into revealing his secrets.
meanings.sent4: The forbidden fruit toled Eve into breaking the divine command.
meanings.sent5: The captivating novel toled her into a world of imagination and desire.
